p:
Among different bacteria, methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus species, third-generation cephalosporin-resistant Escherichia coli, and resistant Pseudomonas aruginosa are the most resistant bacteria.
3 Furthermore, Candida albicans was found to be the cause of two thirds of invasive candidiasis cases. Candida dubliniensis and Candida glabrata are more noticeable because of upward resistance to antifungal drugs.
4
